message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the Labor Force Surveys of 2010 and 2020, we estimated the impact of COVID-19 on employment in the Philippines.", "dataset": ["Labor Force Surveys of 2010", "Labor Force Surveys of 2020"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study explores the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty using data from the World Bank's Global Financial Inclusion Database (Global Findex).", "dataset": ["World Bank's Global Financial Inclusion Database (Global Findex)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "The study is based on household-level panel data collected by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) from Northern Nigeria.", "dataset": ["International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We utilized the LSMS-ISA survey dataset in Uganda to examine the impact of access to improved water sources on child health.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA survey dataset"], "topic": ["Water", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the relationship between education and income inequality using data from the Program for International Student Assessment (PISA) and the World Income Inequality Database (WIID).", "dataset": ["Program for International Student Assessment (PISA)", "World Income Inequality Database (WIID)"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data compiled by the United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination (UNDAC), we examine the effectiveness of early warning systems on the resilience of communities against natural disasters.", "dataset": ["United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination (UNDAC)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "We use the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index (LPI) and the Doing Business report to explore the relationship between transport infrastructure and competitiveness.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index (LPI)", "Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Transport", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the effects of FDI on state-owned enterprises in Vietnam using data from the General Statistics Office (GSO) and World Bank's Enterprise Surveys (WBES).", "dataset": ["General Statistics Office (GSO)", "World Bank's Enterprise Surveys (WBES)"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the effect of climate change on crop yields using data from the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) and the CGIAR Research Program on Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security (CCAFS).", "dataset": ["International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI)", "CGIAR Research Program on Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security (CCAFS)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "By combining data from household surveys and satellite imagery on urban growth, we estimate the impact of urbanization on food security in Africa.", "dataset": ["household surveys", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Agriculture and Food"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "Using the Labor Force Surveys of 2010 and 2020, we estimated the impact of COVID-19 on employment in the Philippines.", "dataset": ["Labor Force Surveys of 2010", "Labor Force household-level panel data collected by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) from Northern Nigeria.", "dataset": ["International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI)"], "topic": resilience of communities against natural disasters.", "dataset": ["United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination (UNDAC)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "We use the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index (LPI) and the Doing Business report to explore the relationship between transport infrastructure and competitiveness.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index (LPI)", "Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Transport", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the effects of FDI on state-owned enterprises in Vietnam using data from the General Statistics Office (GSO) and World Bank's Enterprise Surveys (WBES).", "dataset": ["General Statistics Office (GSO)", "World Bank's Enterprise Surveys (WBES)"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, Agriculture and Food Security (CCAFS).", "dataset": ["International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI)", "CGIAR Research Program on Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security (CCAFS)"], security in Africa.", "dataset": ["household surveys", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Agriculture and Food"]}]
